CatDescriptText: Ruth Wynn, state employe[e], Homewood and Robert N. Reed, bridal shop employe[e], Homewood were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 30, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Are you in favor of increasing the city wage tax to pay salaries for additional police officers in Pittsburgh?  Say, about 500 more?"  Mrs Wynn's answer reads: " Additional policemen are needed, but already there is too much tax.  There should be some other way." Mr. Reed's answer reads: "Yes.  I don't think that it would be too big of an increase."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ruth Wynn wearing light colored head scarf and plaid coat, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Robert N. Reed wearing cap and canvas jacket, standing in front of wall, possibly Empire Building, Downtown
